welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# Discord.js Lite

A fork of [discord.js](https://npm.im/discord.js) intended to decrease CPU and RAM usage.

classes.name: BaseClient
classes.description: The base class for all clients.

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys all assets used by the base client.

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The main hub for interacting with the Discord API, and the starting point for any bot.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the client

props.name: _cleanups
props.description: Functions called when a cache is garbage collected or the Client is destroyed

props.name: _finalizers
props.description: The finalizers used to cleanup items.

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket manager of the client

props.name: actions
props.description: The action manager of the client

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice manager of the client

props.name: shard
props.description: Shard helpers for the client (only if the process was spawned from a {@link ShardingManager})

props.name: users
props.description: All of the {@link User} objects that have been cached at any point, mapped by their ids

props.name: guilds
props.description:
All of the guilds the client is currently handling, mapped by their ids -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* guild the bot is a member of

props.name: channels
props.description:
All of the {@link Channel}s that the client is currently handling, mapped by their ids -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* channel in *every* guild the bot
is a member of. Note that DM channels will not be initially cached, and thus not be present
in the Manager without their explicit fetching or use.

props.name: presence
props.description: The presence of the Client

props.name: token
props.description:
Authorization token for the logged in bot.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.DISCORD_TOKEN` when instantiating the client
<warn>This should be kept private at all times.</warn>

props.name: user
props.description: User that the client is logged in as

props.name: application
props.description: The application of this bot

props.name: readyAt
props.description:
Time at which the client was last regarded as being in the `READY` state
(each time the client disconnects and successfully reconnects, this will be overwritten)

props.name: emojis
props.description: All custom emojis that the client has access to, mapped by their ids

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the time the client was last `READY` at

props.name: uptime
props.description: How long it has been since the client last entered the `READY` state in milliseconds

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a WebSocket connection to Discord.
examples: client.login('my token');

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

returns.description: Token of the account used

methods.name: isReady
methods.description:
Returns whether the client has logged in, indicative of being able to access
properties such as `user` and `application`.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, and destroys the client.

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Obtains an invite from Discord.

params.name: invite
params.description: Invite code or URL

methods.name: fetchGuildTemplate
methods.description: Obtains a template from Discord.

params.name: template
params.description: Template code or URL

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Obtains a webhook from Discord.

params.name: id
params.description: The webhook's id

params.name: token
params.description: Token for the webhook

methods.name: fetchVoiceRegions
methods.description: Obtains the available voice regions from Discord.

methods.name: fetchSticker
methods.description: Obtains a sticker from Discord.

params.name: id
params.description: The sticker's id

methods.name: fetchPremiumStickerPacks
methods.description: Obtains the list of sticker packs available to Nitro subscribers from Discord.

methods.name: _finalize
methods.description: A last ditch cleanup function for garbage collection.

params.name: options.cleanup
params.description: The function called to GC

params.name: options.message
params.description: The message to send after a successful GC

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the item being GCed

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description:
Sweeps all text-based channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.
If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.

params.name: lifetime
params.description:
Messages that are older than this (in seconds)
will be removed from the caches. The default is based on {@link ClientOptions#messageCacheLifetime}

returns.description:
Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,
or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

methods.name: fetchGuildPreview
methods.description: Obtains a guild preview from Discord, available for all guilds the bot is in and all Discoverable guilds.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the preview for

methods.name: fetchGuildWidget
methods.description: Obtains the widget data of a guild from Discord, available for guilds with the widget enabled.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the widget data for

methods.name: generateInvite
methods.description: Generates a link that can be used to invite the bot to a guild.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the invite

methods.name: _eval
methods.description:
Calls {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval} on a script
with the client as `this`.

params.name: script
params.description: Script to eval

methods.name: _validateOptions
methods.description: Validates the client options.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to validate

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild channel is created.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was created

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: ban
params.description: The ban that occurred

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: ban
params.description: The ban that was removed

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild kicks the client or the guild is deleted/left.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

events.name: emojiCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is created in a guild.

params.name: emoji
params.description: The emoji that was created

events.name: emojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is deleted in a guild.

params.name: emoji
params.description: The emoji that was deleted

events.name: emojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is updated in a guild.

params.name: oldEmoji
params.description: The old emoji

params.name: newEmoji
params.description: The new emoji

events.name: guildIntegrationsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild integration is updated

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild whose integrations were updated

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the update

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large guild.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that became available

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

params.name: role
params.description: The role that was created

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

params.name: role
params.description: The role that was deleted

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

params.name: oldRole
params.description: The role before the update

params.name: newRole
params.description: The role after the update

events.name: stickerCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is created in a guild.

params.name: sticker
params.description: The sticker that was created

events.name: stickerDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is deleted in a guild.

params.name: sticker
params.description: The sticker that was deleted

events.name: stickerUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is updated in a guild.

params.name: oldSticker
params.description: The old sticker

params.name: newSticker
params.description: The new sticker

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

params.name: oldGuild
params.description: The guild before the update

params.name: newGuild
params.description: The guild after the update

events.name: interactionCreate
events.description: Emitted when an interaction is created.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction which was created

events.name: interaction
events.description: Emitted when an interaction is created.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction which was created

events.name: inviteCreate
events.description:
Emitted when an invite is created.
<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,
or `MANAGE_CHANNELS` permissions for the channel.</info>

params.name: invite
params.description: The invite that was created

events.name: inviteDelete
events.description:
Emitted when an invite is deleted.
<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,
or `MANAGE_CHANNELS` permissions for the channel.</info>

params.name: invite
params.description: The invite that was deleted

events.name: messageCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

params.name: message
params.description: The created message

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

params.name: message
params.description: The created message

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted.

params.name: message
params.description: The deleted message

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk.

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their id

events.name: messageReactionAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is added to a cached message.

params.name: messageReaction
params.description: The reaction object

params.name: user
params.description: The user that applied the guild or reaction emoji

events.name: messageReactionRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is removed from a cached message.

params.name: messageReaction
params.description: The reaction object

params.name: user
params.description: The user whose emoji or reaction emoji was removed

events.name: messageReactionRemoveAll
events.description: Emitted whenever all reactions are removed from a cached message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message the reactions were removed from

params.name: reactions
params.description: The cached message reactions that were removed.

events.name: messageReactionRemoveEmoji
events.description: Emitted when a bot removes an emoji reaction from a cached message.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was removed

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member's presence (e.g. status, activity) is changed.

params.name: oldPresence
params.description: The presence before the update, if one at all

params.name: newPresence
params.description: The presence after the update

events.name: stageInstanceCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is created.

params.name: stageInstance
params.description: The created stage instance

events.name: stageInstanceDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is deleted.

params.name: stageInstance
params.description: The deleted stage instance

events.name: stageInstanceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance gets updated - e.g. change in topic or privacy level

params.name: oldStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance before the update

params.name: newStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance after the update

events.name: threadCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is created or when the client user is added to a thread.

params.name: thread
params.description: The thread that was created

events.name: threadDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is deleted.

params.name: thread
params.description: The thread that was deleted

events.name: threadListSync
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user gains access to a text or news channel that contains threads

params.name: threads
params.description: The threads that were synced

events.name: threadMembersUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever members are added or removed from a thread. Requires `GUILD_MEMBERS` privileged intent

params.name: oldMembers
params.description: The members before the update

params.name: newMembers
params.description: The members after the update

events.name: threadMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user's thread member is updated.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the update

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel.

params.name: typing
params.description: The typing state

events.name: userUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.
Triggered by the Discord gateway events USER_UPDATE, GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE, and PRESENCE_UPDATE.

params.name: oldUser
params.description: The user before the update

params.name: newUser
params.description: The user after the update

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a member changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldState
params.description: The voice state before the update

params.name: newState
params.description: The voice state after the update

events.name: webhookUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel has its webhooks changed.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that had a webhook update

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted for general warnings.

params.name: info
params.description: The warning

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

params.name: info
params.description: The debug information

events.name: applicationCommandCreate
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is created.

params.name: command
params.description: The command which was created

events.name: applicationCommandDelete
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is deleted.

params.name: command
params.description: The command which was deleted

events.name: applicationCommandUpdate
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is updated.

params.name: oldCommand
params.description: The command before the update

params.name: newCommand
params.description: The command after the update

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event,
not much information can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occurred in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change, channel type change.

params.name: oldChannel
params.description: The channel before the update

params.name: newChannel
params.description: The channel after the update

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The created guild

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has joined a guild

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of guild members is received (all members come from the same guild).

params.name: members
params.description: The members in the chunk

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild related to the member chunk

params.name: chunk
params.description: Properties of the received chunk

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: The message before the update

params.name: newMessage
params.description: The message after the update

events.name: shardResume
events.description: Emitted when a shard resumes successfully.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that resumed

params.name: replayedEvents
params.description: The amount of replayed events

events.name: threadUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is updated - e.g. name change, archive state change, locked state change.

params.name: oldThread
params.description: The thread before the update

params.name: newThread
params.description: The thread after the update

events.name: shardReady
events.description: Emitted when a shard turns ready.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that turned ready

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guild ids, if any

events.name: shardDisconnect
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket disconnects and will no longer reconnect.

params.name: event
params.description: The WebSocket close event

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that disconnected

events.name: shardReconnecting
events.description: Emitted when a shard is attempting to reconnect or re-identify.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that is attempting to reconnect

events.name: invalidated
events.description:
Emitted when the client's session becomes invalidated.
You are expected to handle closing the process gracefully and preventing a boot loop
if you are listening to this event.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the client becomes ready to start working.

params.name: client
params.description: The client

events.name: shardError
events.description: Emitted whenever a shard's WebSocket encounters a connection error.

params.name: error
params.description: The encountered error

params.name: shardId
params.description: The shard that encountered this error

events.name: rateLimit
events.description: Emitted when the client hits a rate limit while making a request

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: Object containing the rate limit info

events.name: apiRequest
events.description:
Emitted before every API request.
This event can emit several times for the same request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.
<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,
it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that is about to be sent

events.name: apiResponse
events.description:
Emitted after every API request has received a response.
This event does not necessarily correlate to completion of the request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.
<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,
it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that triggered this response

params.name: response
params.description: The response received from the Discord API

events.name: invalidRequestWarning
events.description:
Emitted periodically when the process sends invalid requests to let users avoid the
10k invalid requests in 10 minutes threshold that causes a ban

params.name: invalidRequestWarningData
params.description: Object containing the invalid request info

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when the client encounters an error.

params.name: error
params.description: The error encountered

classes.name: ClientVoiceManager
classes.description: Manages voice connections for the client

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this voice manager

props.name: adapters
props.description: Maps guild ids to voice adapters created for use with @discordjs/voice.

classes.name: WebhookClient
classes.description: The webhook client.

params.name: data
params.description: The data of the webhook

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the client

props.name: id
props.description: The webhook's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the webhook was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the webhook was created at

props.name: url
props.description: The URL of this webhook

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message with this webhook.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendSlackMessage
methods.description: Sends a raw slack message with this webhook.

params.name: body
params.description: The raw body to send

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this webhook.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for editing the webhook

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for editing the webhook

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The id of the message to fetch

params.name: cacheOrOptions
params.description:
The options to provide to fetch the message.
A **deprecated** boolean may be passed instead to specify whether to cache the message.

returns.description:
Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a
{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: editMessage
methods.description: Edits a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to edit

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

returns.description:
Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a
{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the webhook.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for deleting this webhook

methods.name: deleteMessage
methods.description: Delete a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to delete

params.name: threadId
params.description: The id of the thread this message belongs to

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys all assets used by the base client.

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

classes.name: WebSocketManager
classes.description:
The WebSocket manager for this client.
<info>This class forwards raw dispatch events,
read more about it here {@link https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway}</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this WebSocketManager

props.name: gateway
props.description: The gateway this manager uses

props.name: totalShards
props.description: The amount of shards this manager handles

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of all shards this manager handles

props.name: shardQueue
props.description: An array of shards to be connected or that need to reconnect

props.name: packetQueue
props.description: An array of queued events before this WebSocketManager became ready

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of this WebSocketManager

props.name: destroyed
props.description: If this manager was destroyed. It will prevent shards from reconnecting

props.name: reconnecting
props.description: If this manager is currently reconnecting one or multiple shards

props.name: ping
props.description: The average ping of all WebSocketShards

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug message.

params.name: message
params.description: The debug message

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that emitted this message, if any

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects this manager to the gateway.

methods.name: createShards
methods.description: Handles the creation of a shard.

methods.name: reconnect
methods.description: Handles reconnects for this manager.

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Broadcasts a packet to every shard this manager handles.

params.name: packet
params.description: The packet to send

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this manager and all its shards.

methods.name: handlePacket
methods.description: Processes a packet and queues it if this WebSocketManager is not ready.

params.name: packet
params.description: The packet to be handled

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that will handle this packet

methods.name: checkShardsReady
methods.description: Checks whether the client is ready to be marked as ready.

methods.name: triggerClientReady
methods.description: Causes the client to be marked as ready and emits the ready event.

classes.name: WebSocketShard
classes.description: Represents a Shard's WebSocket connection

props.name: manager
props.description: The WebSocketManager of the shard

props.name: id
props.description: The shard's id

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of the shard

props.name: sequence
props.description: The current sequence of the shard

props.name: closeSequence
props.description: The sequence of the shard after close

props.name: sessionId
props.description: The current session id of the shard

props.name: ping
props.description: The previous heartbeat ping of the shard

props.name: lastPingTimestamp
props.description: The last time a ping was sent (a timestamp)

props.name: lastHeartbeatAcked
props.description: If we received a heartbeat ack back. Used to identify zombie connections

props.name: ratelimit
props.description: Contains the rate limit queue and metadata

props.name: connection
props.description: The WebSocket connection for the current shard

props.name: inflate
props.description: The compression to use

props.name: helloTimeout
props.description: The HELLO timeout

props.name: eventsAttached
props.description: If the manager attached its event handlers on the shard

props.name: expectedGuilds
props.description: A set of guild ids this shard expects to receive

props.name: readyTimeout
props.description: The ready timeout

props.name: connectedAt
props.description: Time when the WebSocket connection was opened

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug event.

params.name: message
params.description: The debug message

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects the shard to the gateway.

returns.description:
A promise that will resolve if the shard turns ready successfully,
or reject if we couldn't connect

methods.name: onOpen
methods.description: Called whenever a connection is opened to the gateway.

methods.name: onMessage
methods.description: Called whenever a message is received.

params.name: event
params.description: Event received

methods.name: onError
methods.description: Called whenever an error occurs with the WebSocket.

params.name: event
params.description: The error that occurred

methods.name: onClose
methods.description: Called whenever a connection to the gateway is closed.

params.name: event
params.description: Close event that was received

methods.name: onPacket
methods.description: Called whenever a packet is received.

params.name: packet
params.description: The received packet

methods.name: checkReady
methods.description: Checks if the shard can be marked as ready

methods.name: setHelloTimeout
methods.description: Sets the HELLO packet timeout.

params.name: time
params.description: If set to -1, it will clear the hello timeout

methods.name: setHeartbeatTimer
methods.description: Sets the heartbeat timer for this shard.

params.name: time
params.description: If -1, clears the interval, any other number sets an interval

methods.name: sendHeartbeat
methods.description:
Sends a heartbeat to the WebSocket.
If this shard didn't receive a heartbeat last time, it will destroy it and reconnect

params.name: tag
params.description: What caused this heartbeat to be sent

params.name: ignoreHeartbeatAck
params.description: If we should send the heartbeat forcefully.

methods.name: ackHeartbeat
methods.description: Acknowledges a heartbeat.

methods.name: identify
methods.description: Identifies the client on the connection.

methods.name: identifyNew
methods.description: Identifies as a new connection on the gateway.

methods.name: identifyResume
methods.description: Resumes a session on the gateway.

methods.name: send
methods.description:
Adds a packet to the queue to be sent to the gateway.
<warn>If you use this method, make sure you understand that you need to provide
a full [Payload](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway#commands-and-events-gateway-commands).
Do not use this method if you don't know what you're doing.</warn>

params.name: data
params.description: The full packet to send

params.name: important
params.description: If this packet should be added first in queue

methods.name: _send
methods.description: Sends data, bypassing the queue.

params.name: data
params.description: Packet to send

methods.name: processQueue
methods.description: Processes the current WebSocket queue.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this shard and closes its WebSocket connection.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for destroying the shard
params.default: { closeCode: 1000, reset: false, emit: true, log: true }

methods.name: _cleanupConnection
methods.description: Cleans up the WebSocket connection listeners.

methods.name: _emitDestroyed
methods.description: Emits the DESTROYED event on the shard

events.name: close
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket closes.

params.name: event
params.description: The received event

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the shard receives the READY payload and is now waiting for guilds

events.name: resumed
events.description: Emitted when the shard resumes successfully

events.name: allReady
events.description:
Emitted when the shard is fully ready.
This event is emitted if:
* all guilds were received by this shard
* the ready timeout expired, and some guilds are unavailable

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guilds, if any

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Emitted when a shard is destroyed, but no WebSocket connection was present.

methods.description: Fetches member(s) from Discord, even if they're offline.
examples:
// Fetch a single member without checking cache
guild.members.fetch({ user, force: true })
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

params.name: options
params.description:
If a UserResolvable, the user to fetch.
If undefined, fetches all members.
If a query, it limits the results to users with similar usernames.

methods.description: Searches for members in the guild based on a query.

methods.description: Lists up to 1000 members of the guild.

<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

params.description: The data to edit the member with

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for editing this user

params.description: Options for pruning

<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for kicking

Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user's id will be the result.

methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to ban

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the ban

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user id will be the result.
Internally calls the GuildBanManager#create method.

classes.name: Shard
classes.description:
A self-contained shard created by the {@link ShardingManager}. Each one has a {@link ChildProcess} that contains
an instance of the bot and its {@link Client}. When its child process/worker exits for any reason, the shard will
spawn a new one to replace it as necessary.

props.name: manager
props.description: Manager that created the shard

props.name: id
props.description: The shard's id in the manager

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: env
props.description: Environment variables for the shard's process, or workerData for the shard's worker

props.name: ready
props.description: Whether the shard's {@link Client} is ready

props.name: process
props.description: Process of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: worker
props.description: Worker of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `worker`)

props.name: _evals
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#eval}, mapped by the `script` they were called with

props.name: _fetches
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#fetchClientValue}, mapped by the `prop` they were called with

props.name: _exitListener
props.description: Listener function for the {@link ChildProcess}' `exit` event

methods.name: spawn
methods.description:
Forks a child process or creates a worker thread for the shard.
<warn>You should not need to call this manually.</warn>

params.name: timeout
params.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client} has become ready
before resolving (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

methods.name: kill
methods.description: Immediately kills the shard's process/worker and does not restart it.

methods.name: respawn
methods.description: Kills and restarts the shard's process/worker.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for respawning the shard

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to the shard's process/worker.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to send to the shard

methods.name: fetchClientValue
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of the shard.

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

methods.name: eval
methods.description: Evaluates a script or function on the shard, in the context of the {@link Client}.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on the shard

returns.description: Result of the script execution

methods.name: _handleMessage
methods.description: Handles a message received from the child process/worker.

params.name: message
params.description: Message received

methods.name: _handleExit
methods.description: Handles the shard's process/worker exiting.

params.name: respawn
params.description: Whether to spawn the shard again

params.name: timeout
params.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client}
has become ready (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that makes multi-process sharding of a bot an easy and painless experience.
It works by spawning a self-contained {@link ChildProcess} or {@link Worker} for each individual shard, each
containing its own instance of your bot's {@link Client}. They all have a line of communication with the master
process, and there are several useful methods that utilise it in order to simplify tasks that are normally difficult
with sharding. It can spawn a specific number of shards or the amount that Discord suggests for the bot, and takes a
path to your main bot script to launch for each one.

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the sharding manager

props.name: file
props.description: Path to the shard script file

props.name: shardList
props.description: List of shards this sharding manager spawns

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Amount of shards that all sharding managers spawn in total

props.name: mode
props.description: Mode for shards to spawn with

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: shardArgs
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to shards (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to the executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

methods.name: createShard
methods.description:
Creates a single shard.
<warn>Using this method is usually not necessary if you use the spawn method.</warn>

params.name: id
params.description:
Id of the shard to create
<info>This is usually not necessary to manually specify.</info>

returns.description: Note that the created shard needs to be explicitly spawned using its spawn method.

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for spawning shards

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Sends a message to all shards.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be sent to the shards

methods.name: broadcastEval
methods.description: Evaluates a script on all shards, or a given shard, in the context of the {@link Client}s.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on each shard

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the broadcast

returns.description: Results of the script execution

methods.name: fetchClientValues
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of each shard, or a given shard.

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

params.name: shard
params.description: Shard to fetch property from, all if undefined

methods.name: _performOnShards
methods.description: Runs a method with given arguments on all shards, or a given shard.

params.name: method
params.description: Method name to run on each shard

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass through to the method call

params.name: shard
params.description: Shard to run on, all if undefined

returns.description: Results of the method execution

methods.name: respawnAll
methods.description: Kills all running shards and respawns them.

methods.description: Deletes this command.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this command equals another command. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `command.id === command2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

params.name: command
params.description: The command to compare with

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options and choices are in the same
order in the array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

methods.name: optionsEqual
methods.description:
Recursively checks that all options for an {@link ApplicationCommand} are equal to the provided options.
In most cases it is better to compare using {@link ApplicationCommand#equals}

params.description:
The options on the existing command,
should be {@link ApplicationCommand#options}

params.name: options
params.description: The options to compare against

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options and choices are in the same
order in the array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

methods.name: _optionEquals
methods.description:
Checks that an option for an {@link ApplicationCommand} is equal to the provided option
In most cases it is better to compare using {@link ApplicationCommand#equals}

params.name: existing
params.description:
The option on the existing command,
should be from {@link ApplicationCommand#options}

params.name: option
params.description: The option to compare against

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options or choices are in the same
order in their array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

classes.name: InteractionCollector
classes.description:
Collects interactions.
Will automatically stop if the message ({@link Client#event:messageDelete messageDelete}),
channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}), or
guild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.

params.name: client
params.description: The client on which to collect interactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: messageId
props.description: The message from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: channelId
props.description: The channel from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: guildId
props.description: The guild from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: interactionType
props.description: The type of interaction to collect

props.name: componentType
props.description: The type of component to collect

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have interacted with this collector

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of interactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming interaction for possible collection.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction to possibly collect

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles an interaction for possible disposal.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that could be disposed of

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this interaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was deleted

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for reseting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is collected.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that was collected

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is disposed of.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that was disposed of

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a message on Discord.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel the message was sent in

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild the message was sent in, if any

props.name: deleted
props.description: Whether this message has been deleted

props.name: id
props.description: The message's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was sent at

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the message

props.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

props.name: content
props.description: The content of the message

props.name: author
props.description: The author of the message

props.name: pinned
props.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

props.name: nonce
props.description:
A random number or string used for checking message delivery
<warn>This is only received after the message was sent successfully, and
lost if re-fetched</warn>

props.name: embeds
props.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

props.description: A list of MessageActionRows in the message

props.name: stickers

props.name: editedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: reactions
props.description: A manager of the reactions belonging to this message

props.name: mentions
props.description: All valid mentions that the message contains

props.name: webhookId
props.description: The id of the webhook that sent the message, if applicable

props.name: groupActivityApplication
props.description: Supplemental application information for group activities

props.name: applicationId
props.description: The id of the application of the interaction that sent this message, if any

props.name: activity
props.description: Group activity

props.name: flags
props.description: Flags that are applied to the message

props.name: reference
props.description: Message reference data

props.name: interaction
props.description: Partial data of the interaction that this message is a reply to

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the message was sent in

props.name: partial
props.description: Whether or not this message is a partial

props.name: member
props.description:
Represents the author of the message as a guild member.
Only available if the message comes from a guild where the author is still a member

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the message was sent at

props.name: editedAt
props.description: The time the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the message was sent in (if in a guild channel)

props.name: hasThread
props.description: Whether this message has a thread associated with it

props.name: thread
props.description:
The thread started by this message

use {@link Message#hasThread} instead.</info>

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to jump to this message

props.name: cleanContent
props.description:
The message contents with all mentions replaced by the equivalent text.
If mentions cannot be resolved to a name, the relevant mention in the message content will not be converted.

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the message is editable by the client user

props.name: deletable

props.name: pinnable

params.name: options

methods.name: crosspost
methods.description: Publishes a message in an announcement channel to all channels following it.

methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages.
examples:
// Pin a message
message.pin()
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

// Unpin a message
message.unpin()
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

params.description: Options for starting a thread on this message

methods.description: Fetch this message.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: suppressEmbeds
methods.description: Suppresses or unsuppresses embeds on a message.

params.name: suppress
params.description: If the embeds should be suppressed or not

methods.name: removeAttachments
methods.description: Removes the attachments from this message.

methods.name: resolveComponent
methods.description: Resolves a component by a custom id.

params.name: customId
params.description: The custom id to resolve against

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples:
// Logs: Message: This is a message!
console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description:
Collects messages on a channel.
Will automatically stop if the channel (`'channelDelete'`) or guild (`'guildDelete'`) are deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel

params.name: options
params.description: The options to be applied to this collector

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel

props.name: received
props.description: Total number of messages that were received in the channel during message collection

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles a message for possible collection.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be collected

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a message for possible disposal.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be disposed of

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for reseting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is collected.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was collected

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is disposed of.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was disposed of

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

classes.name: MessageMentions

props.description:
Any users that were mentioned
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: roles
props.description:
Any roles that were mentioned
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: _members
props.description: Cached members for {@link MessageMentions#members}

props.name: _channels
props.description: Cached channels for {@link MessageMentions#channels}

props.name: crosspostedChannels
props.description:
A collection of crossposted channels
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: repliedUser
props.description: The author of the message that this message is a reply to

props.name: members
props.description:
Any members that were mentioned (only in {@link Guild}s)
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: channels
props.description:
Any channels that were mentioned
<info>Order as they appear first in the message content</info>

props.name: EVERYONE_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches `@everyone` and `@here`

props.name: USERS_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches user mentions like `<@81440962496172032>`

props.name: ROLES_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches role mentions like `<@&297577916114403338>`

props.name: CHANNELS_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches channel mentions like `<#222079895583457280>`

methods.name: has

Checks if a user, guild member, role, or channel is mentioned.
Takes into account user mentions, role mentions, and `@everyone`/`@here` mentions.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the check

classes.name: ReactionCollector
classes.description:
Collects reactions on messages.
Will automatically stop if the message (`'messageDelete'`),
channel (`'channelDelete'`), or guild (`'guildDelete'`) are deleted.

params.name: message
params.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: message
props.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have reacted to this message

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of reactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming reaction for possible collection.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly collect

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a reaction deletion for possible disposal.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly dispose of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this reaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was deleted

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for reseting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

methods.name: key
methods.description: Gets the collector key for a reaction.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The message reaction to get the key for

events.name: create
events.description:
Emitted whenever a reaction is newly created on a message. Will emit only when a new reaction is
added to the message, as opposed to {@link Collector#collect} which will
be emitted even when a reaction has already been added to the message.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was added

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is collected.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was collected

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had all the users removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was disposed of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had one user removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was removed

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

classes.name: ReactionEmoji
classes.description:
Represents a limited emoji set used for both custom and unicode emojis. Custom emojis
will use this class opposed to the Emoji class when the client doesn't know enough
information about them.

props.name: reaction
props.description: The message reaction this emoji refers to

props.name: animated
props.description: Whether or not the emoji is animated

props.name: name
props.description: The emoji's name

props.name: id
props.description: The emoji's id

props.name: deleted
props.description: Whether this emoji has been deleted

props.name: identifier
props.description: The identifier of this emoji, used for message reactions

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the emoji file if it's a custom emoji

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the text required to form a graphical emoji on Discord
instead of the Emoji object.
examples:
// Send the emoji used in a reaction to the channel the reaction is part of
reaction.message.channel.send(`The emoji used was: ${reaction.emoji}`);

props.description: The guild the thread is in

<info>Always `null` in public threads</info>

props.description: Whether the thread is archived

props.description:
The timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed

created</info>

props.description: The id of the member who created this thread

props.description:
The approximate count of messages in this thread

`ThreadChannel#messages.cache.size`</info>

props.name: memberCount
props.description:
The approximate count of users in this thread
<info>This stops counting at 50. If you need an approximate value higher than that, use
`ThreadChannel#members.cache.size`</info>

props.description: A collection of associated guild member objects of this thread's members

props.name: archivedAt
props.description:

props.description: The parent channel of this thread

classes.name: VoiceState
classes.description: Represents the voice state for a Guild Member.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild of this voice state

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the member of this voice state

props.name: serverDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is deafened server-wide

props.name: serverMute
props.description: Whether this member is muted server-wide

props.name: selfDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is self-deafened

props.name: selfMute
props.description: Whether this member is self-muted

props.name: selfVideo
props.description: Whether this member's camera is enabled

props.name: sessionId
props.description: The session id for this member's connection

props.name: streaming
props.description: Whether this member is streaming using "Screen Share"

props.name: channelId
props.description: The {@link VoiceChannel} or {@link StageChannel} id the member is in

props.name: suppress
props.description: Whether this member is suppressed from speaking. This property is specific to stage channels only.

props.name: requestToSpeakTimestamp
props.description: The time at which the member requested to speak. This property is specific to stage channels only.

props.name: member
props.description: The member that this voice state belongs to

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the member is connected to

props.name: deaf
props.description: Whether this member is either self-deafened or server-deafened

props.name: mute
props.description: Whether this member is either self-muted or server-muted

methods.name: setMute
methods.description: Mutes/unmutes the member of this voice state.

params.name: mute
params.description: Whether or not the member should be muted

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for muting or unmuting

methods.name: setDeaf
methods.description: Deafens/undeafens the member of this voice state.

params.name: deaf
params.description: Whether or not the member should be deafened

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for deafening or undeafening

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the member from the channel.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for disconnecting the member from the channel

methods.name: setChannel
methods.description: Moves the member to a different channel, or disconnects them from the one they're in.

params.name: channel
params.description:
Channel to move the member to, or `null` if you want to
disconnect them from voice.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for moving member to another channel or disconnecting

methods.name: setRequestToSpeak
methods.description:
Toggles the request to speak in the channel.
Only applicable for stage channels and for the client's own voice state.
examples:
// Making the client request to speak in a stage channel (raise its hand)
guild.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(true);

// Making the client cancel a request to speak
guild.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(false);

params.name: request
params.description: Whether or not the client is requesting to become a speaker.

methods.name: setSuppressed
methods.description: Suppress/unsuppress the user. Only applicable for stage channels.
examples:
// Making the client a speaker
guild.me.voice.setSuppressed(false);

// Making the client an audience member
guild.me.voice.setSuppressed(true);

// Inviting another user to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(false);

// Moving another user to the audience, or cancelling their invite to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(true);

params.name: suppressed
params.description: Whether or not the user should be suppressed.

classes.name: Options
classes.description: Contains various utilities for client options.

props.name: defaultMakeCacheSettings
props.description:
The default settings passed to {@link Options.cacheWithLimits}.
The caches that this changes are:
* `MessageManager` - Limit to 200 messages
* `ChannelManager` - Sweep archived threads
* `GuildChannelManager` - Sweep archived threads
* `ThreadManager` - Sweep archived threads
<info>If you want to keep default behavior and add on top of it you can use this object and add on to it, e.g.
`makeCache: Options.cacheWithLimits({ ...Options.defaultMakeCacheSettings, ReactionManager: 0 })`</info>

methods.name: createDefault
methods.description: The default client options.

methods.name: cacheWithLimits
methods.description: Create a cache factory using predefined settings to sweep or limit.

params.name: settings
params.description:
Settings passed to the relevant constructor.
If no setting is provided for a manager, it uses Collection.
If a number is provided for a manager, it uses that number as the max size for a LimitedCollection.
If LimitedCollectionOptions are provided for a manager, it uses those settings to form a LimitedCollection.

methods.name: cacheEverything
methods.description: Create a cache factory that always caches everything.

classes.name: Permissions
classes.description:
Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a permission bitfield. All {@link GuildMember}s have a set of
permissions in their guild, and each channel in the guild may also have {@link PermissionOverwrites} for the member
that override their default permissions.

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits

props.name: FLAGS
props.description:
Numeric permission flags. All available properties:
* `CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE` (create invitations to the guild)
* `KICK_MEMBERS`
* `BAN_MEMBERS`
* `ADMINISTRATOR` (implicitly has *all* permissions, and bypasses all channel overwrites)
* `MANAGE_CHANNELS` (edit and reorder channels)
* `MANAGE_GUILD` (edit the guild information, region, etc.)
* `ADD_REACTIONS` (add new reactions to messages)
* `VIEW_AUDIT_LOG`
* `PRIORITY_SPEAKER`
* `STREAM`
* `VIEW_CHANNEL`
* `SEND_MESSAGES`
* `SEND_TTS_MESSAGES`
* `MANAGE_MESSAGES` (delete messages and reactions)
* `EMBED_LINKS` (links posted will have a preview embedded)
* `ATTACH_FILES`
* `READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY` (view messages that were posted prior to opening Discord)
* `MENTION_EVERYONE`
* `USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS` (use emojis from different guilds)
* `VIEW_GUILD_INSIGHTS`
* `CONNECT` (connect to a voice channel)
* `SPEAK` (speak in a voice channel)
* `MUTE_MEMBERS` (mute members across all voice channels)
* `DEAFEN_MEMBERS` (deafen members across all voice channels)
* `MOVE_MEMBERS` (move members between voice channels)
* `USE_VAD` (use voice activity detection)
* `CHANGE_NICKNAME`
* `MANAGE_NICKNAMES` (change other members' nicknames)
* `MANAGE_ROLES`
* `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS`
* `MANAGE_EMOJIS_AND_STICKERS`
* `USE_APPLICATION_COMMANDS`
* `REQUEST_TO_SPEAK`
* `MANAGE_THREADS`
* `USE_PUBLIC_THREADS` (deprecated)
* `CREATE_PUBLIC_THREADS`
* `USE_PRIVATE_THREADS` (deprecated)
* `CREATE_PRIVATE_THREADS`
* `USE_EXTERNAL_STICKERS` (use stickers from different guilds)
* `SEND_MESSAGES_IN_THREADS`
* `START_EMBEDDED_ACTIVITIES`

typedefs.name: ThreadAutoArchiveDuration
typedefs.description:
A number that is allowed to be the duration (in minutes) of inactivity after which a thread is automatically
archived. This can be:
* `60` (1 hour)
* `1440` (1 day)
* `4320` (3 days) <warn>This is only available when the guild has the `THREE_DAY_THREAD_ARCHIVE` feature.</warn>
* `10080` (7 days) <warn>This is only available when the guild has the `SEVEN_DAY_THREAD_ARCHIVE` feature.</warn>
* `'MAX'` Based on the guild's features

typedefs.name: ThreadCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options for creating a thread. <warn>Only one of `startMessage` or `type` can be defined.</warn>

props.name: startMessage
props.description:
The message to start a thread from. <warn>If this is defined then type
of thread gets automatically defined and cannot be changed. The provided `type` field will be ignored</warn>

props.name: type
props.description:
The type of thread to create. Defaults to `GUILD_PUBLIC_THREAD` if
created in a {@link TextChannel} <warn>When creating threads in a {@link NewsChannel} this is ignored and is always
`GUILD_NEWS_THREAD`</warn>

props.name: invitable
props.description:
Whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to the thread
<info>Can only be set when type will be `GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD`</info>

typedefs.name: FetchThreadsOptions
typedefs.description: The options for fetching multiple threads, the properties are mutually exclusive

props.name: archived
props.description: The options used to fetch archived threads

props.name: active
props.description: When true, fetches active threads. <warn>If `archived` is set, this is ignored!</warn>

typedefs.name: DateResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to a Date object. This can be:
* A Date object
* A number representing a timestamp
* An [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) string

typedefs.description: The options used to fetch archived threads.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of threads to fetch, either `public` or `private`

props.name: fetchAll
props.description:
Whether to fetch **all** archived threads when type is `private`.
Requires `MANAGE_THREADS` if true

props.name: before
props.description:
Only return threads that were created before this Date
or Snowflake. <warn>Must be a {@link ThreadChannelResolvable} when type is `private` and fetchAll is `false`</warn>

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of threads to return

typedefs.name: FetchedThreads
typedefs.description: The data returned from a thread fetch that returns multiple threads.

props.name: threads
props.description: The threads that were fetched, with any members returned

props.name: hasMore
props.description: Whether there are potentially additional threads that require a subsequent call

props.description: Time in ms remaining before the count resets

typedefs.name: ShardRespawnOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to respawn a shard.

props.name: delay
props.description:
How long to wait between killing the process/worker and
restarting it (in milliseconds)

props.name: timeout
props.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client}
has become ready before resolving (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

typedefs.name: ShardingManagerMode
typedefs.description:
The mode to spawn shards with for a {@link ShardingManager}. Can be either one of:
* 'process' to use child processes
* 'worker' to use [Worker threads](https://nodejs.org/api/worker_threads.html)

typedefs.name: ShardingManagerOptions
typedefs.description: The options to spawn shards with for a {@link ShardingManager}.

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Number of total shards of all shard managers or "auto"

props.name: shardList
props.description: List of shards to spawn or "auto"

props.name: mode
props.description: Which mode to use for shards

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: shardArgs
props.description:
Arguments to pass to the shard script when spawning
(only available when mode is set to 'process')

props.name: execArgv
props.description:
Arguments to pass to the shard script executable when spawning
(only available when mode is set to 'process')

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for automatic shard count and passing to shards

typedefs.name: MultipleShardSpawnOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to spawn multiple shards.

props.name: amount
props.description: Number of shards to spawn

props.name: delay
props.description: How long to wait in between spawning each shard (in milliseconds)

props.name: timeout
props.description: The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client} has become ready

typedefs.name: BroadcastEvalOptions
typedefs.description: Options for {@link ShardingManager#broadcastEval} and {@link ShardClientUtil#broadcastEval}.

props.name: shard
props.description: Shard to run script on, all if undefined

props.name: context
props.description: The JSON-serializable values to call the script with

typedefs.name: MultipleShardRespawnOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to respawn all shards.

props.name: shardDelay
props.description: How long to wait between shards (in milliseconds)

props.name: respawnDelay
props.description:
How long to wait between killing a shard's process and restarting it
(in milliseconds)

props.name: timeout
props.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait for a shard to become ready before
continuing to another (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)
