typedefs.name: AuditLogTargetType
typedefs.description:
The target type of an entry. Here are the available types:
* GUILD
* CHANNEL
* USER
* ROLE
* INVITE
* WEBHOOK
* EMOJI
* MESSAGE
* INTEGRATION
* STAGE_INSTANCE
* STICKER
* THREAD

typedefs.name: AuditLogAction
typedefs.description:
The action of an entry. Here are the available actions:
* ALL: null
* GUILD_UPDATE: 1
* CHANNEL_CREATE: 10
* CHANNEL_UPDATE: 11
* CHANNEL_DELETE: 12
* CHANNEL_OVERWRITE_CREATE: 13
* CHANNEL_OVERWRITE_UPDATE: 14
* CHANNEL_OVERWRITE_DELETE: 15
* MEMBER_KICK: 20
* MEMBER_PRUNE: 21
* MEMBER_BAN_ADD: 22
* MEMBER_BAN_REMOVE: 23
* MEMBER_UPDATE: 24
* MEMBER_ROLE_UPDATE: 25
* MEMBER_MOVE: 26
* MEMBER_DISCONNECT: 27
* BOT_ADD: 28,
* ROLE_CREATE: 30
* ROLE_UPDATE: 31
* ROLE_DELETE: 32
* INVITE_CREATE: 40
* INVITE_UPDATE: 41
* INVITE_DELETE: 42
* WEBHOOK_CREATE: 50
* WEBHOOK_UPDATE: 51
* WEBHOOK_DELETE: 52
* EMOJI_CREATE: 60
* EMOJI_UPDATE: 61
* EMOJI_DELETE: 62
* MESSAGE_DELETE: 72
* MESSAGE_BULK_DELETE: 73
* MESSAGE_PIN: 74
* MESSAGE_UNPIN: 75
* INTEGRATION_CREATE: 80
* INTEGRATION_UPDATE: 81
* INTEGRATION_DELETE: 82
* STAGE_INSTANCE_CREATE: 83
* STAGE_INSTANCE_UPDATE: 84
* STAGE_INSTANCE_DELETE: 85
* STICKER_CREATE: 90
* STICKER_UPDATE: 91
* STICKER_DELETE: 92
* THREAD_CREATE: 110
* THREAD_UPDATE: 111
* THREAD_DELETE: 112

typedefs.name: AuditLogEntryTarget
typedefs.description:
The target of an entry. It can be one of:
* A guild
* A channel
* A user
* A role
* An invite
* A webhook
* An emoji
* A message
* An integration
* A stage instance
* A sticker
* A thread
* An object with an id key if target was deleted
* An object where the keys represent either the new value or the old value

typedefs.name: AuditLogActionType
typedefs.description:
The action type of an entry, e.g. `CREATE`. Here are the available types:
* CREATE
* DELETE

* ALL

typedefs.name: InviteScope
typedefs.description:
A valid scope to request when generating an invite link.
<warn>Scopes that require whitelist are not considered valid for this generator</warn>
* `applications.builds.read`: allows reading build data for a users applications
* `applications.commands`: allows this bot to create commands in the server
* `applications.entitlements`: allows reading entitlements for a users applications
* `applications.store.update`: allows reading and updating of store data for a users applications
* `bot`: makes the bot join the selected guild
* `connections`: makes the endpoint for getting a users connections available
* `email`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint return with an email
* `identify`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint without an email
* `guilds`: makes the `/users/@me/guilds` endpoint available for a user
* `guilds.join`: allows the bot to join the user to any guild it is in using Guild#addMember
* `gdm.join`: allows joining the user to a group dm
* `webhook.incoming`: generates a webhook to a channel

This can pose a security risk when the URL has not been sanitized</warn>

typedefs.name: TimestampStylesString
typedefs.description:
A message formatting timestamp style, as defined in
[here](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#message-formatting-timestamp-styles).
* `t` Short time format, consisting of hours and minutes, e.g. 16:20.
* `T` Long time format, consisting of hours, minutes, and seconds, e.g. 16:20:30.
* `d` Short date format, consisting of day, month, and year, e.g. 20/04/2021.
* `D` Long date format, consisting of day, month, and year, e.g. 20 April 2021.
* `f` Short date-time format, consisting of short date and short time formats, e.g. 20 April 2021 16:20.
* `F` Long date-time format, consisting of long date and short time formats, e.g. Tuesday, 20 April 2021 16:20.
* `R` Relative time format, consisting of a relative duration format, e.g. 2 months ago.

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection being swept

typedefs.name: LimitedCollectionOptions
typedefs.description: Options for defining the behavior of a LimitedCollection

props.name: maxSize
props.description: The maximum size of the Collection

props.name: keepOverLimit
props.description:
A function, which is passed the value and key of an entry, ran to decide
to keep an entry past the maximum size

props.name: sweepFilter
props.description: A function ran every `sweepInterval` to determine how to sweep

props.name: sweepInterval
props.description: How frequently, in seconds, to sweep the collection.

typedefs.name: LifetimeFilterOptions
typedefs.description: Options for generating a filter function based on lifetime

props.name: lifetime
props.description:
How long, in seconds, an entry should stay in the collection
before it is considered sweepable.

props.name: getComparisonTimestamp
props.description:
A function that takes an entry, key,
and the collection and returns a timestamp to compare against in order to determine the lifetime of the entry.

props.name: excludeFromSweep
props.description:
A function that takes an entry, key, and the collection
and returns a boolean, `true` when the entry should not be checked for sweepability.

typedefs.name: RateLimitData

props.name: timeout
props.description: Time until this rate limit ends, in ms

props.description: The maximum amount of requests of this endpoint

props.name: method
props.description: The HTTP method of this request

props.name: path
props.description: The path of the request relative to the HTTP endpoint

props.name: route
props.description: The route of the request relative to the HTTP endpoint

props.name: global
props.description: Whether this is a global rate limit

typedefs.name: RateLimitQueueFilter
typedefs.description: Whether this rate limit should throw an Error

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: The data of this rate limit

params.name: manager
params.description: The manager class the cache is being requested from.

params.name: holds
params.description: The class that the cache will hold.

returns.description: A Collection used to store the cache of the manager.

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options for a client.

props.name: shards
props.description:
The shard's id to run, or an array of shard ids. If not specified,
the client will spawn {@link ClientOptions#shardCount} shards. If set to `auto`, it will fetch the
recommended amount of shards from Discord and spawn that amount

props.name: shardCount
props.description:
The total amount of shards used by all processes of this bot
(e.g. recommended shard count, shard count of the ShardingManager)

props.name: makeCache
props.description:
Function to create a cache.
You can use your own function, or the {@link Options} class to customize the Collection used for the cache.
<warn>Overriding the cache used in `GuildManager`, `ChannelManager`, `GuildChannelManager`, `RoleManager`,
and `PermissionOverwriteManager` is unsupported and **will** break functionality</warn>

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description:
DEPRECATED: Use `makeCache` with a `LimitedCollection` instead.
How long a message should stay in the cache until it is considered sweepable (in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description:
DEPRECATED: Use `makeCache` with a `LimitedCollection` instead.
How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older than the message cache lifetime
(in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: allowedMentions
props.description: Default value for {@link MessageOptions#allowedMentions}

props.name: invalidRequestWarningInterval
props.description:
The number of invalid REST requests (those that return
401, 403, or 429) in a 10 minute window between emitted warnings (0 for no warnings). That is, if set to 500,
warnings will be emitted at invalid request number 500, 1000, 1500, and so on.

props.name: partials
props.description:
Structures allowed to be partial. This means events can be emitted even when
they're missing all the data for a particular structure. See the "Partial Structures" topic on the
[guide](https://discordjs.guide/popular-topics/partials.html) for some
important usage information, as partials require you to put checks in place when handling data.

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description:
Maximum time permitted between REST responses and their
corresponding WebSocket events

props.name: restTimeOffset
props.description:
Extra time in milliseconds to wait before continuing to make REST
requests (higher values will reduce rate-limiting errors on bad connections)

props.name: restRequestTimeout
props.description: Time to wait before cancelling a REST request, in milliseconds

props.name: restSweepInterval
props.description:
How frequently to delete inactive request buckets, in seconds
(or 0 for never)

props.name: restGlobalRateLimit
props.description:
How many requests to allow sending per second (0 for unlimited, 50 for
the standard global limit used by Discord)

props.name: rejectOnRateLimit
props.description:
Decides how rate limits and pre-emptive throttles
should be handled. If this option is an array containing the prefix of the request route (e.g. /channels to match any
route starting with /channels, such as /channels/222197033908436994/messages) or a function returning true, a
{@link RateLimitError} will be thrown. Otherwise the request will be queued for later

props.name: retryLimit
props.description:
How many times to retry on 5XX errors
(Infinity for an indefinite amount of retries)

props.name: failIfNotExists
props.description: Default value for {@link ReplyMessageOptions#failIfNotExists}

props.name: userAgentSuffix
props.description:
An array of additional bot info to be appended to the end of the required
[User Agent](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#user-agent) header

props.name: presence
props.description: Presence data to use upon login

props.name: intents
props.description: Intents to enable for this connection

props.name: ws
props.description: Options for the WebSocket

props.name: http
props.description: HTTP options

typedefs.name: WebsocketOptions
typedefs.description: WebSocket options (these are left as snake_case to match the API)

props.name: large_threshold
props.description:
Number of members in a guild after which offline users will no longer be
sent in the initial guild member list, must be between 50 and 250

typedefs.name: AgentOptions
typedefs.description: HTTPS Agent options.

typedefs.name: HTTPOptions
typedefs.description: HTTP options

props.name: version
props.description: API version to use

props.name: agent
props.description: HTTPS Agent options

props.name: api
props.description: Base URL of the API

props.name: cdn
props.description: Base URL of the CDN

props.name: invite
props.description: Base URL of invites

props.name: template
props.description: Base URL of templates

props.name: headers
props.description: Additional headers to send for all API requests

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string (see {@link Permissions.FLAGS})
* A permission number
* An instance of Permissions
* An Array of PermissionResolvable

typedefs.name: Snowflake
typedefs.description:
A {@link https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-ids Twitter snowflake},
except the epoch is 2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z.

If we have a snowflake '266241948824764416' we can represent it as binary:
```
64                                          22     17     12          0
 000000111011000111100001101001000101000000  00001  00000  000000000000
      number of ms since Discord epoch       worker  pid    increment
```

typedefs.name: DeconstructedSnowflake
typedefs.description: A deconstructed snowflake.

props.name: timestamp
props.description: Timestamp the snowflake was created

props.name: date
props.description: Date the snowflake was created

props.name: workerId
props.description: The worker's id in the snowflake

props.name: processId
props.description: The process's id in the snowflake

props.name: increment
props.description: Increment in the snowflake

props.name: binary
props.description: Binary representation of the snowflake

typedefs.name: SystemChannelFlagsResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a system channel flag bitfield. This can be:
* A string (see {@link SystemChannelFlags.FLAGS})
* A system channel flag
* An instance of SystemChannelFlags
* An Array of SystemChannelFlagsResolvable

typedefs.name: SplitOptions
typedefs.description: Options for splitting a message.

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum character length per message piece

props.name: char
props.description:
Character(s) or Regex(es) to split the message with,
an array can be used to split multiple times

props.name: prepend
props.description: Text to prepend to every piece except the first

props.name: append
props.description: Text to append to every piece except the last

typedefs.name: EscapeMarkdownOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to escape markdown.

props.name: codeBlock
props.description: Whether to escape code blocks or not

props.name: inlineCode
props.description: Whether to escape inline code or not

props.name: bold
props.description: Whether to escape bolds or not

props.name: italic
props.description: Whether to escape italics or not

props.name: underline
props.description: Whether to escape underlines or not

props.name: strikethrough
props.description: Whether to escape strikethroughs or not

props.name: spoiler
props.description: Whether to escape spoilers or not

props.name: codeBlockContent
props.description: Whether to escape text inside code blocks or not

props.name: inlineCodeContent
props.description: Whether to escape text inside inline code or not

props.name: guildsPerShard
props.description: Number of guilds assigned per shard

props.name: multipleOf
props.description: The multiple the shard count should round up to. (16 for large bot sharding)

typedefs.name: MakeErrorOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to make an error object.

props.name: name
props.description: Error type

props.name: message
props.description: Message for the error

props.name: stack
props.description: Stack for the error

typedefs.name: ColorResolvable
typedefs.description:
Can be a number, hex string, an RGB array like:
```js
[255, 0, 255] // purple
```
or one of the following strings:
- `DEFAULT`
- `WHITE`
- `AQUA`
- `GREEN`
- `BLUE`
- `YELLOW`
- `PURPLE`
- `LUMINOUS_VIVID_PINK`
- `FUCHSIA`
- `GOLD`
- `ORANGE`
- `RED`
- `GREY`
- `NAVY`
- `DARK_AQUA`
- `DARK_GREEN`
- `DARK_BLUE`
- `DARK_PURPLE`
- `DARK_VIVID_PINK`
- `DARK_GOLD`
- `DARK_ORANGE`
- `DARK_RED`
- `DARK_GREY`
- `DARKER_GREY`
- `LIGHT_GREY`
- `DARK_NAVY`
- `BLURPLE`
- `GREYPLE`
- `DARK_BUT_NOT_BLACK`
- `NOT_QUITE_BLACK`
- `RANDOM`
